solution_line_template: Joey studies {hours_per_night} hours a night {nights_per_week} nights a week so that's {hours_per_night}*{nights_per_week} = <<{hours_per_night}*{nights_per_week}={weekday_hours}>>{weekday_hours} hours
He studies {hours_per_weekend_day} hours a day on the weekends so that's {hours_per_weekend_day}*{weekend_days} = <<{hours_per_weekend_day}*{weekend_days}={weekend_hours}>>{weekend_hours} hours
In one week, Joey studies {weekday_hours}+{weekend_hours} = <<{weekday_hours}+{weekend_hours}={weekly_hours}>>{weekly_hours} hours

He has {weeks_until_exam} weeks till his exams and he studies for {weekly_hours} hours a week so that's {weeks_until_exam}*{weekly_hours} = <<{weeks_until_exam}*{weekly_hours}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours of studying
